column4: Is there a way to tell terminal that I want to run each command with sudo until exit? Or do I need to type sudo each time?
Type "sudo bash".  Then it's basically like you're root until you type "exit".
There are more ways than those two too.
Flannel: Thanks. I only need to do it for the next five commands, then I'll restart terminal. I know not to run it constantly. =P Not unless I want someone to kick me out of the loop.
